title: The Hobbit
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an epic adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Moby-Dick
description: The novel follows the adventures of Ishmael, a sailor aboard the whaling ship Pequod, who embarks on a journey to seek revenge on the white sperm whale Moby Dick.
author: Herman Melville

title: The Alchemist
description: The story follows Santiago, a young Andalusian shepherd who dreams of traveling the world in search of a worldly treasure as extravagant as any ever found.
author: Paulo Coelho

title: A Game of Thrones
description: The novel chronicles the power struggles among noble families to gain control of the Iron Throne of the Seven Kingdoms, with the series of civil wars and large-scale battles interspersed with political intrigue and personal drama.
author: George R.R. Martin

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
description: The series narrates the adventures of various children who play central roles in the unfolding history of the Narnian world.
author: C.S. Lewis

title: The Road
description: The novel follows a father and his young son as they journey through a post-apocalyptic America, trying to survive and maintain their humanity in a world stripped of civilization and social structure.
author: Cormac McCarthy

title: Anna Karenina
description: The novel explores the themes of passion and fidelity, the impact of family on individuals, and the role of society in determining one's fate.
author: Leo Tolstoy
